title: PMr Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Great perfect easy efficient and it was easy and good and prefect and effiecient. Easy negotiation for pay. Do your research and everything will flow easily. The interview process is as is and there should be a horing freeze soon so be dure to interview
Interview Questions: What are you strengths and weakness

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: Fast & efficient - friendly. Quick responses by the group. Zoom interview less than 30 mins. Like the people and the mission. Could be a bit more clear about the next steps.
Interview Questions: What are the best parts of your current job?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: I enjoyed my interview and felt I was well respected and learned a lot. They expressed clear interest in my experiences and what I was looking for in a job and answered many questions
Interview Questions: Describe a time you worked with a coworker from another discipline

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Cambridge, MA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, very relaxed and easy. Interviewer was personable and conversation flowed easily. Interviewer said he wanted to have a “conversation “ rather than an “interview”. We talked for about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Talked to me about what I did during the lockdown that was new for me

title: Integrated Behavioral Health Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Boston, MA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was coordinated and smooth. The first interview was a phone screening with the hiring manager, the second with colleagues on the team. The last interview would have been with the medical director.
Interview Questions: Share a situation where you advocated on behalf of a patient to the primary care team.

title: Program and Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: It has been very lengthy; two months so far and just now to the offer discussion. But everyone has been very kind. I felt like my questions were answered well. A timeline of expectations would have been helpful though.
Interview Questions: What interested me most about the job.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: Multiple emails, then multiple interviews. Very nice manager and team. A very long process but to me that means that they are looking for the right candidate for their team to mesh well within their current needs and for future growth.
Interview Questions: What is a project you have been on that you felt was very successful for you.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: Talk with office manager and meeting with two staff nurses in primary care clinic. Easy going and casual conversation. Nice staff and took the time to answer my questions. Overall good experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions:
I was selected to interview for Clinical Research Coordinator. I interviewed a total of 3 times. I met with 4 individuals who's teams I would be assisting with as well as the director. 

Was asked different questions across the three interviews.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with diversity and how is it important to you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight and to the point overall. 2 phone interviews with talent acquisition representatives, followed by a formal interview with nurse manager. The whole hiring process took approximately 3-4 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this specialty (psych)?

title: Performance Improvement Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was great and precise, very neat interview process. They answered my questions about the organization and it was a great discussion. It really felt like a discussion not as an interview
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience and why that makes you a good fit?

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: Online application then a phone call interview with Human Resources then scheduled a Google Meets interview with nurse managers.  Interview typically lasts 30-45 minutes depending on length of responses. Then wait a couple days for results.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in CHA

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: Very professional. I enjoyed meeting many of the staff. It was a multi person interview. Very relaxed. Felt like I was making nice connections even if it didn’t turn into a job. Took a bit of time to hear back so I ended up taking another job.
Interview Questions: Typical rehab questions. Pleasant and conversational.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Cambridge, MA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was just like any other nursing interview but via google meet. Met with the manager and was asked the typical  questions based on your specialty. I did psych Rn
Interview Questions:
Why should we hire you? 

Tell us about a difficult time you had with a patient or colleague and how did you resolve it?

Tell me about yourself? 

What are your strength vs weaknesses? 

What is your 5 to 10 year goals?

title: Emergency Department Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Everett, MA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the former Nurse Manager of the department. The interview was straightforward; had to answer questions like what my former roles looked like, why I wanted to work there, what I can bring to the position, etc. Was offered the position after a day or two and was pleased to accept. The job itself was alright- good pay, consistent scheduling, and room for overtime. However, this hospital system is not for the weak. Managing all kinds of personalities and having strong interpersonal skills are necessary if you want to last long in your role.
Interview Questions: We serve an underprivileged community. How will you care for all kinds of patients?

title: Registered Nurse Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Cambridge, MA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer spoke only about herself.  Pertinent questions about the job itself was limited.  Interviewer overshadowed the ability for the rest of the panel to ask pertinent questions.  Limited time was allowed for me to ask questions with clarification.  Follow up was long and delayed where I literally lost interest in the position.
Interview Questions: What makes you the best

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, waited to be called back about an interview, interviewed with manager, and then a panel of staff. Heard back later that day with an offer. Really fun and easy process to go through!
Interview Questions: Experience in the field, education, experience within the population.

title: Advanced Practice Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: Laid back process. Everyone was very friendly and more interested in ensuring I was informed about the position and in getting to know me as a potential future colleague than in grilling me.
Interview Questions: What would a former supervisor say are your biggest strengths and weaknesses?

title: ER Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back in about a week or two. Had an in person interview with the nursing manager and nursing educator. Both members were very nice and made me feel welcomed. About a week and a half later I got a phone call from HR offering me the job and spoke with them about my prehire physical and orientation.
Interview Questions: What’s your least favorite type of patient?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Boston, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: first they had a phone interview,  talked for about half an hour and then they were pretty quicked and made an offer. The offer was fair and started in 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: How would you implement a web site from scratch?

title: Grants Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Cambridge, MA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was very informal and straightforward, more of a 2-way conversation instead of the usual interview "test questions" interviewers usually ask.  Hiring managers were very kind and sincere, provided a clear explanation of the work involved and the potential opportunities for growth at CHA and why they enjoy working there.  They seem more interested in getting to know you as a person to work with than seeing how well you can answer standard interview questions, which reflected well on their workplace culture and values.
Interview Questions: If I knew certain Microsoft Office program.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: I went in to interview for an RA position at a research institution under CHA. This was the second round. I talked to the two directors, 30 min each, and completed an hour-long writing assignment.
Interview Questions: Standard questions like why our program? What makes you interested in research? Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Recruitment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Cambridge, MA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a wonderful interview process! I met with the HR team and the Director of Talent Acquisition. We talked about the company, the team and the position and it was a really great conversation. Everyone really seemed to enjoy what they do and who they work for. I truly enjoyed the experience. I found that they created a really genuine, low stress, but very informative interview overall.
Interview Questions:
What interested you in the position?

What is your background in HR?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Cambridge, MA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Great questions asked by the employer. Asked about my past experiences and where do I see myself in 5 years. Also my past educational experience. The lady that interviewed me was very pleasant and made me feel very welcomed.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself In 5 years.

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Somerville, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of two interviews, one with your direct managers, and the second second with the head of the department. If your managers like you and have mentioned good things about you to the head of the department the second interview will go well and be more like a conversation then an interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Comprehensive Interview with various groups from the practice.  Good communication from HR regarding the process and very timely responses to questions regarding next steps.  The interview was three rounds that ended with a group/panel interview with various stakeholders/members of the staff.
Interview Questions: They asked me questions about my experiences and greatest challenges.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Cambridge, MA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: easy, did not seam very interested in me as a candidate.  Interviewer yawned a few times and that kind of turned me off.  Also slaray offered was really low for the time
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 3 years

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Cambridge, MA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and to the point.  Met manager and he brought me back, asked a few questions. He kept asking me more questions. After he asked me more questions. Then after he asked me more questions.
Interview Questions: How do you adapt quicky? How was your last job? How was the previous job?

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: Interviews tend to be the group model.  No real structure to them as far as an official format.  Other than a few standard interview questions, the interviews specifically in the IT department tend to be more relaxed and informal. Focus on work experience/knowledge base as well as how a personality will fit in with this dynamic group hold equal weight.
Interview Questions: Do you work best as part of a group or would you rather work alone?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process took three months. HR is very very slow. Interviewed over webcam, then went in to tour the lab. I also had to get a physical and drug test.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance
Interview Descriptions: Mine was an internal hire. My boss offered me the position without a process but I asked him to "put it through the process" because I needed my team to feel they got the person they wanted. While it seemed like a pretty straightforward request, it then took him NINE MONTHS to make it happen, meanwhile I was doing 2 jobs for the entire time.
Interview Questions: n/a

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Cambridge, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Given a detailed itinerary by recruiter, met with everyone from division, including chief of medicine, took tours of the facilities, drove to different sites to meet everyone. Everyone was very friendly
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Cambridge, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Manager was flexible in meeting with me. Overall the department itself want highly train employees with experience. HR/Occupational health is very slow with the hiring process. Overall everything was straight forward
Interview Questions: How many prescriptions could you type?

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Everett, MA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour interview with Nursing Supervisor. Discussed skills, goals, work experience, education- the normal interview questions. After the interview I received a tour of the unit. I was able to ask staff questions and see the pt population. It was a good experience.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my training/education and where I would like to be (career-wise) in the future.

title: Per Diem Occupational Medicine Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Somerville, MA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Employer put out information for a part-time occupational medicine physician and request a CV. on the occupational and environmental medicine listserve. I responded with an attached CV and they arranged an in person interview.
Interview Questions: I don't remember any question that is difficult.

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Cambridge, MA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: It is a quick process interview. You just have to prove that you have experience in the field.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary

title: Pediatric Staff Neuropsychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cambridge Health Alliance (Medford, MA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed 2-3 times. First with sr. neuropsychologist in this particular building. Wasn't even aware I was interviewing. I was just attending a seminar she ran - I hadn't even been looking for a job. One day she told me that her supervisor wanted to speak with me. I figured that perhaps the company didn't want  outsiders participating in in-house activities. He and I spoke very easily and casually about a shared mid-West connection, what I liked to do with the children we saw, and other basic schools of thought in terms of neuropsychological theory. I remember being absolutely stunned when he told me they were hiring and would I like to be on their staff.
Interview Questions: N/A
